resources.string: The island is a historical area that serves as a tranquil reminder of the colonial European period, with quiet pedestrian avenues flanked by trees and lined by historical buildings in various states of upkeep.
North Bank of Baie Bond, Liwan District, Guangzhou

Baiyun Mountain covers a large area of northeast Guangzhou. It has been considered to be the top natural scenic part of the city since ancient times due to its magnificence and loftiness. The name Baiyun Mountain means White Cloud Mountain because the summit is wreathed in clouds whenever the sky clears after rain.
Baiyun S Ave, Baiyun Diet Culture Gallery, Baiyun, Guangzhou
Yuexiu Hill once formed the northern end of the old walled city, though most of the walls have been dismantled and the city has now expanded far beyond it.

The Museum of the Western Han Dynasty Mausoleum of the Nanyue King houses the 2,000-year-old tomb of the Nanyue King Zhao Mo in Guangzhou. Zhao Mo ruled from 137 BC to 122 BC, and his tomb was discovered in downtown Guangzhou in 1983.

Located downstream of the Pearl River, the opera house looks like two pebbles washed and smoothed by the river. The irregular-shaped buildings and the towers of Guangzhou CBD look like a fantasy landscape.
1 Zhujiang W Rd, Tianhe District, Guangzhou
Guangzhou International Finance Center is the most modern area in Guangzhou. It gradually becomes the new center of Guangzhou. And many spectacular skyscrapers are built in this area.

Pearl River is the mother river of Guangzhou. The city was expanded rapidly along with the river. The night view of Pearl River is really great. You can walk on the river bank or have a boat trip here.
